title: Sniper Elite 4 (Rebellion)
author: Torrente
siteName: TouchArcade - iPhone, iPad, Android Games Forum
text: https://toucharcade.com/2024/06/06/sniper-elite-4-mobile-release-date-iphone-ipad-mac-holiday-season-rebellion/ I like the sniper elite games. It’s a really cool concept. You sneak around, looking for high ground and taking your time.. Lining up that perfect shot.. BAM! Watch that ballsack explode in glorious slowmotion! And then you relocate and do it all over again. I think a slower paced fps-game like Sniper Elite can be well suited for mobile. What do you think? The person who made that video must have some issues. Come on man, it’s all good and fun. I think it reflect a perfect sense of humor. In the second game you can shoot Hitler in the balls - that has to account for something. Right!? Have you played a S.E game? The series are pretty old today. The first one released 2005 acording to wikipedia. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sniper_Elite I would have guessed later, but apperently not. I have the first three games on Steam, but I have only played the third one. I had fun with it as I recall. Nice graphics and smooth gameplay. More of a ”Metal Gear” experiance than a action shooter. I have no clue how the series evolved to now tho. But I think the concept can fit on mobile. It’s a little more slow experiance. No twitch shooting. At least not if you play as it should be played. Yeah, it's sorta hilarious, no problem with that. I meant the person who made the video, focused solely on ballshots, must be nuts. I mean... why? As a gameplay feature, it's quite good. After all, it makes it more realistic and offers a challenge.Nah, I don't really enjoy "realistic" warfare games. I like 3rd/FPS games, but in a sci-fi or cartoon-ish setting, like Bioshock or Fortnite. For war, terrorism and crime, I rather check the news.I remember playing some sniping games, made with stickmen design. I liked their mechanics which involved keeping in mind factors suchs as distance and wind direction. The slowmo xray shots its basically the main feature of the Sniper Elite games. It doesnt have to be nutshots of course. Thats is more of a internet meme. Its nothing to get upset about. Mortal Kombat does it too. I think they stole it from Sniper Elite. It is a gimmick after all, whats good about the games is more that the gameplay and pacing of the games is slower. You are fragile and you can’t go in guns blazing in every situation. You will die if you run around and shoot like crazy - you have to think a bit and sneak around. i shouldnt say too much because of course I have no clue what this game will be about, or if it even will be any good. But I dont think you should reject it just because I linked a goofy YT-video. Check it out when it comes out. Maybe you will like the concept? I have an iPhone 8, it's probably not gonna be supported. Still, it's a game about killing people, so it's not my kind of game; for me, targets have to be monsters, aliens, mutants, robots or people (only in more fictitious scenarios). Ok. I think I understand. Is it a religious believe you have. Or is it something else? I mean that you can’t kill fictious humanoids in a videogame. Good to know it’s not just me; I get a kick out of most fantasy violence but the medical detail shown here would make me feel like a sadistic psycho - probably a lot of fun but not how I want to feel. Have you looked at some actual gameplay? It’s not a sadistic psycho game at all. I dont understand where you people get that from!? Check out the trailer! I’m fine with killing fake people in games. What next ? Moaning that tom and Jerry is violent ? I’ve killed space invaders in the 80s. Mutants in Doom and Quake in the 90s. Crashed my car into others in GTA (and didn’t leave insurance details as it’s all fake and just a game !) and ran over people. Nazis in Call of duty and more. It’s all fake and I don’t feel guilty for killing aliens or sprites of humans ! It’s just a game looks to be a good game. Never played the original. I'm not religious at all; you know some religious groups have killed real people in the [not so distant] past, right? ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ I just don't like violence that's "similar" to the real world. I don't feel guilty or sick about those AI people, it's just not appealing as a videogame scenario; as I said, for me, it's just like watching the news, except in games it's possible to go over the top without real consequences. Tom & Jerry is one of my favorite cartoons. Definitely unrelated to the kind of violence I dislike, though. In other media, I'm fine with realistic violence, though; I kind of like WWs content in movies, for example. It's just towards videogames that I'm not inclined for such themes. Staff Member Patreon Silver Frankly, not sure why anyone should have to explain their personal preferences. Gaming should be fun. If seeing closeups of internal damage is not fun for you, then it’s not fun — period. That doesn’t make @sebgo a weird person, and he’s certainly not criticizing anyone’s preference. Me, I’m looking forward to this . I do believe that Sniper Elite 4 has the ability to turn off both kill cam and the X-ray camera if the medical scene are too much. Edit: It was recommended a bit back then when it was released, so the developers added that option. Also YouTubers were also getting their gameplay videos either age restricted or removed.​ Ok. No need to get worked up about it. I guess you never did play any of the more modern Mortal Kombat titles? Protip - Stay clear of those. That stuff is pretty intense.Really? I did play the second one, or if it was the therd. But I dont remember that option. It was a long time ago so I could have missed it. There is a zombie nazi-shooter with the same hallmarks as S.E. I cant remember now if it is a spinn off, or if it is a official entry in the S.E series. More in the line with CoD: Zombies. its way more goofy tho. They dont aim for that ”realism” as S.E Oh, I love all the gore and violence in all of the Mortal Kombat (and other titles/genres as well, such as Unreal Tournament) games I've seen or played [for a bit]. I suck at playing them (I haven't been able to adapt to their mechanics), though, so it's not my kind of fighting game. That doesn't mean I'm good at any fighting game, but I've enjoyed others in the genre. I think people got my reaction towards the nutshots video wrong: I'm not bothered by explicit violence. I think I stated I don't like "realistic war" games, and implied it's mostly because they remind me of real life situations and, for me, games are meant to take me away from it. I don't mind the killing or the way it's performed, I just don't care about the setting. About the nutshots video, I still wonder why anyone would make a video full of it; I mean... 100 shots video? 10 would have been enough to enjoy the show. Maybe they have a tic? Haha Staff Member Patreon Silver You are probably thinking about this: Yes I’m pretty sure for the fourth version. I’m not sure about the earlier versions of Sniper Elite though 1,2,3. Most likely, I have a hard time remembering but I do recognize the splash screen. Share This Page
html:
1. https://toucharcade.com/2024/06/06/sniper-elite-4-mobile-release-date-iphone-ipad-mac-holiday-season-rebellion/

    I like the sniper elite games. It’s a really cool concept. You sneak around, looking for high ground and taking your time.. Lining up that perfect shot.. BAM! Watch that ballsack explode in glorious slowmotion!

    And then you relocate and do it all over again.

    I think a slower paced fps-game like Sniper Elite can be well suited for mobile. What do you think?

  2. The person who made that video must have some issues.
  3. Come on man, it’s all good and fun. I think it reflect a perfect sense of humor. In the second game you can shoot Hitler in the balls - that has to account for something. Right!?

    Have you played a S.E game? The series are pretty old today. The first one released 2005 acording to wikipedia. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sniper_Elite

    I would have guessed later, but apperently not. I have the first three games on Steam, but I have only played the third one. I had fun with it as I recall. Nice graphics and smooth gameplay. More of a ”Metal Gear” experiance than a action shooter. I have no clue how the series evolved to now tho.

    But I think the concept can fit on mobile. It’s a little more slow experiance. No twitch shooting. At least not if you play as it should be played.

  4. Yeah, it's sorta hilarious, no problem with that. I meant the person who made the video, focused solely on ballshots, must be nuts. I mean... why?

    As a gameplay feature, it's quite good. After all, it makes it more realistic and offers a challenge.

    Nah, I don't really enjoy "realistic" warfare games. I like 3rd/FPS games, but in a sci-fi or cartoon-ish setting, like Bioshock or Fortnite. For war, terrorism and crime, I rather check the news.I remember playing some sniping games, made with stickmen design. I liked their mechanics which involved keeping in mind factors suchs as distance and wind direction.
  5. The slowmo xray shots its basically the main feature of the Sniper Elite games. It doesnt have to be nutshots of course. Thats is more of a internet meme. Its nothing to get upset about. Mortal Kombat does it too. I think they stole it from Sniper Elite.

    It is a gimmick after all, whats good about the games is more that the gameplay and pacing of the games is slower. You are fragile and you can’t go in guns blazing in every situation. You will die if you run around and shoot like crazy - you have to think a bit and sneak around.

    i shouldnt say too much because of course I have no clue what this game will be about, or if it even will be any good. But I dont think you should reject it just because I linked a goofy YT-video.

    Check it out when it comes out. Maybe you will like the concept?

  6. I have an iPhone 8, it's probably not gonna be supported. Still, it's a game about killing people, so it's not my kind of game; for me, targets have to be monsters, aliens, mutants, robots or people (only in more fictitious scenarios).
  7. Ok. I think I understand.

    Is it a religious believe you have. Or is it something else? I mean that you can’t kill fictious humanoids in a videogame.

  8. Good to know it’s not just me; I get a kick out of most fantasy violence but the medical detail shown here would make me feel like a sadistic psycho - probably a lot of fun but not how I want to feel.
  9. Have you looked at some actual gameplay? It’s not a sadistic psycho game at all. I dont understand where you people get that from!?

    Check out the trailer!

  10. I’m fine with killing fake people in games. What next ? Moaning that tom and Jerry is violent ?

    I’ve killed space invaders in the 80s. Mutants in Doom and Quake in the 90s. Crashed my car into others in GTA (and didn’t leave insurance details as it’s all fake and just a game !) and ran over people. Nazis in Call of duty and more. It’s all fake and I don’t feel guilty for killing aliens or sprites of humans ! It’s just a game

    looks to be a good game. Never played the original.

  11. I'm not religious at all; you know some religious groups have killed real people in the [not so distant] past, right?
    ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

    I just don't like violence that's "similar" to the real world. I don't feel guilty or sick about those AI people, it's just not appealing as a videogame scenario; as I said, for me, it's just like watching the news, except in games it's possible to go over the top without real consequences.

    Tom & Jerry is one of my favorite cartoons. Definitely unrelated to the kind of violence I dislike, though. In other media, I'm fine with realistic violence, though; I kind of like WWs content in movies, for example. It's just towards videogames that I'm not inclined for such themes.

  12. Staff Member Patreon Silver

    Frankly, not sure why anyone should have to explain their personal preferences. Gaming should be fun. If seeing closeups of internal damage is not fun for you, then it’s not fun — period. That doesn’t make @sebgo a weird person, and he’s certainly not criticizing anyone’s preference.

    Me, I’m looking forward to this .

  13. I do believe that Sniper Elite 4 has the ability to turn off both kill cam and the X-ray camera if the medical scene are too much.

    Edit:
    It was recommended a bit back then when it was released, so the developers added that option.

    Also YouTubers were also getting their gameplay videos either age restricted or removed.​

  15. Ok. No need to get worked up about it.

    I guess you never did play any of the more modern Mortal Kombat titles? Protip - Stay clear of those. That stuff is pretty intense.

    Really? I did play the second one, or if it was the therd. But I dont remember that option. It was a long time ago so I could have missed it.
  16. There is a zombie nazi-shooter with the same hallmarks as S.E. I cant remember now if it is a spinn off, or if it is a official entry in the S.E series. More in the line with CoD: Zombies.

    its way more goofy tho. They dont aim for that ”realism” as S.E

  17. Oh, I love all the gore and violence in all of the Mortal Kombat (and other titles/genres as well, such as Unreal Tournament) games I've seen or played [for a bit]. I suck at playing them (I haven't been able to adapt to their mechanics), though, so it's not my kind of fighting game. That doesn't mean I'm good at any fighting game, but I've enjoyed others in the genre.

    I think people got my reaction towards the nutshots video wrong: I'm not bothered by explicit violence. I think I stated I don't like "realistic war" games, and implied it's mostly because they remind me of real life situations and, for me, games are meant to take me away from it. I don't mind the killing or the way it's performed, I just don't care about the setting.

    About the nutshots video, I still wonder why anyone would make a video full of it; I mean... 100 shots video? 10 would have been enough to enjoy the show. Maybe they have a tic? Haha

  18. Staff Member Patreon Silver

    You are probably thinking about this:
  19. Yes I’m pretty sure for the fourth version. I’m not sure about the earlier versions of Sniper Elite though 1,2,3.
  20. Most likely, I have a hard time remembering but I do recognize the splash screen.

Share This Page
